intro: Pasania dalbertisii, commonly known as the red-flowered pasania, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking red or orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a small, spherical drupe that contains a single seed.
